title: Gmail Configuration Error
content: Hello, I just downloaded the Thunderbird email client and am trying to add my gmail accounts, but it won't accept them and says it is unable to log in at server. The gmail pop-up should happen to allow access, but no pop-up happens. I have followed the instructions per your guidelines (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/automatic-conversion-google-mail-accounts-oauth20), enabled cookies and added exceptions, but have had no success. Please help.
creator: seawaterspirit

title: Giant draft filled with images
content:
Hi. This is going to be a strange question for you. Someone in my family (inexperienced with computers), pasted daily PNG screengrabs into a draft for a month, hoping to email it to somebody. They didn’t understand it would create a massive 300mb draft that could not be sent. The screengrabs can’t be taken again, so this is the only place they’re saved.

So I thought I would simply save out the draft as an HTML file, which has the images embedded. However, the HTML file only shows the images up to a point (only shows 10 out of 30), after which it’s just blank white space. That’s because there’s a little yellow banner at the bottom of the draft with an Options button saying the images have been locked, and I need to unlock them in order to include them in the draft. When I do that for all 20 images, however, they don’t appear in the email body, so even if I save out an HTML file after that, it still only shows a blank space. I thought maybe hitting F5 to refresh the screen would do it, but it doesn’t. Nor does trying to forward the draft as a new draft (still blank space). Maybe you now of a way to refresh the draft view?

When I unlocked all the images, I could see some of the path, which looked like they were saved inside the Draft mailbox file (I could even see the PNG extension for each image). So I was thinking, maybe there’s a way to access the files inside the mailbox in order to extract the PNGs but unfortunately I couldn’t find one.

So if you have any suggestions for my predicament, I would be grateful. - Alan
creator: fireos5

title: Help with emails
content: Over the last few weeks, first some personal emails were coming with content that was line after line of letters and numbers and symbols. But could be read properly via webmail. After some Tech Help that but was OK (but font appeared different to usual) however the other emails from businesses (advertising basically) etc appeared either blank, or just not in usual 'attractive' format with pictures and text. There was minimal text interspersed with lots of info in blue starting with htpps// The same Tech Help people were unable to sort it and said to contact service provider.
creator: Keryn

title: inbox folder shows blank tab on startup, restarting Thunderbird solves problem
content: On startup Thunderbird 128.3.3 esr Nebula shows startup messages screen but no inboxes or messages are visible, it downloads messages but the display panel and mailbox tabs list remain empty. On restart the inbox screen is populated normally with the downloaded messages. This is intermittent and a restart has always cleared the problem so far.
creator: old_nic

title: send not working

I bypass the problem by leaving the message, saving it to drafts and with my smartphone I srnd the draft! Something else happens since some time, do not know if it is related: when I open TB and go to inbox, it shows an inbox that's not up to date. After a minute it refreshes to the present inbox. Pls help, TY

title: Can not import mails
content:
Hi!

We have email info@dorsum.by on Yandex

We changed the domain owner to the new account.

Before changing we exported all mails from account with zip backup.

Now we created the new info@dorsum.by email.

When I trying to import backuped account old letters dont appear in the new email account. When Imported it shows 18k emails, but we can't scroll down to see them. When relaunch the app only new emails (29) are shown.

How to import letters correct?

Thank you!
creator: alex.baradun

title: Send does not work with CardBook enabled
content:
Since upgrading to version 128.3.3esr (Build 20241023091249) on Arch Linux sending messages does not work any more. After clicking the Send button, choosing Send in the toolbar menu, or using <Ctrl>+<Enter>, all buttons and the toolbar menu becomes inactive (greyed out), but the message is not send. The behavior occurs on different mail accounts.

When starting Thunderbird from the terminal the following error occurs: JavaScript error: moz-extension://cd757c35-cc8e-45ec-b1a7-c66dfbe94276/background.js, line 3070: TypeError: action is undefined

Restarting Thunderbird in safe-mode resolves this issue and there is no error message in the terminal.

Deactivating add-ons one by one, as mentioned in [1120568], reveals that CardBook seems to be causing this issue. For this reason, I sent a copy of this question to the add-on support contact.
creator: thisven
